problem_names: lemma prod_UNIV[iff]: "A \<times> B = UNIV \<longleftrightarrow> A = UNIV \<and> B = UNIV"

lemma prod_singleton:
    "fst ` A = {x} \<Longrightarrow> A = fst ` A \<times> snd ` A"
    "snd ` A = {y} \<Longrightarrow> A = fst ` A \<times> snd ` A"
lemma infinite_subset[trans]: "infinite A \<Longrightarrow> A \<subseteq> B \<Longrightarrow> infinite B"
lemma finite_subset[trans]: "A \<subseteq> B \<Longrightarrow> finite B \<Longrightarrow> finite A"

lemma infinite_psubset_coinduct[case_names infinite, consumes 1]:
    assumes "R A"
    assumes "\<And> A. R A \<Longrightarrow> \<exists> B \<subset> A. R B"
    shows "infinite A"
lemma inj_inj_on[dest]: "inj f \<Longrightarrow> inj_on f S"
translations: lemmas [simp] = map_prod.id map_prod.comp[symmetric]
lemma prod_UNIV[iff]: "A \<times> B = UNIV \<longleftrightarrow> A = UNIV \<and> B = UNIV"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (A \<times> B = UNIV) = (A = UNIV \<and> B = UNIV)
by auto

lemma prod_singleton:
    "fst ` A = {x} \<Longrightarrow> A = fst ` A \<times> snd ` A"
    "snd ` A = {y} \<Longrightarrow> A = fst ` A \<times> snd ` A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (fst ` A = {x} \<Longrightarrow> A = fst ` A \<times> snd ` A) &&&
    (snd ` A = {y} \<Longrightarrow> A = fst ` A \<times> snd ` A)
by force+
lemma infinite_subset[trans]: "infinite A \<Longrightarrow> A \<subseteq> B \<Longrightarrow> infinite B"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>infinite A; A \<subseteq> B\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> infinite B
using infinite_super

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>?S \<subseteq> ?T; infinite ?S\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> infinite ?T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>infinite A; A \<subseteq> B\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> infinite B
by this
lemma finite_subset[trans]: "A \<subseteq> B \<Longrightarrow> finite B \<Longrightarrow> finite A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>A \<subseteq> B; finite B\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> finite A
using finite_subset

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>?A \<subseteq> ?B; finite ?B\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> finite ?A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>A \<subseteq> B; finite B\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> finite A
by this
declare infinite_coinduct[case_names infinite, coinduct pred: infinite]

lemma infinite_psubset_coinduct[case_names infinite, consumes 1]:
    assumes "R A"
    assumes "\<And> A. R A \<Longrightarrow> \<exists> B \<subset> A. R B"
    shows "infinite A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. infinite A
proof

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. finite A \<Longrightarrow> False
show "False" if "finite A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. False
using that assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  finite A
  R A
  R ?A \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>B\<subset>?A. R B

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. False
by (induct rule: finite_psubset_induct) (auto)

proof (state)
this:
  finite A \<Longrightarrow> False

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
(* TODO: why are there two copies of this theorem? *)
thm inj_on_subset subset_inj_on
lemma inj_inj_on[dest]: "inj f \<Longrightarrow> inj_on f S"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. inj f \<Longrightarrow> inj_on f S
using inj_on_subset

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>inj_on ?f ?A; ?B \<subseteq> ?A\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> inj_on ?f ?B

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. inj f \<Longrightarrow> inj_on f S
by auto
end
